title: Grievous Wounds is a wasted game mechanic.
body: Now before people start telling me how useful {{item:3165}}  is, I should elaborate. Yes this is a very good item, and yes the passive is very useful. So why is this STILL the only item to date that has this passive? As someone who does not tend to play a lot of mages it upsets me that when I go against a champion will excellent healing. I feel like there is a SEVERE lack out counter play to heal heavy champions. The only way to apply this debuff without being a mage is to take {{summoner:14}}. Anyone even remotely familiar with how top lane or even ADC works knows the problems this. Are there any new items in the workshop that will help resolve this horrible unbalance? I mean how obvious can this be riot???? How many champions have a way to heal WITHOUT items giving spell vamp/life steal, and we still only have one (mages only)counter item?

replies.body: What you fail to realize is that Rito is slowly removing Grievous Wounds from the game.  Every few patches, they remove it from yet another champion and they've already removed every other way of applying it save Morellonomicon and Ignite.  As things currently stand, the only 2 champs left in the game that can apply it are Kat and Varus.  Whereas in the past we used to have Fizz, Trist, MF and et cetera.  By this time next year, the mechanic may not even exist anymore.

the problem with grievous wounds being super accessible rather than situational (even nomicon is situational as you have to get them low in the first place, and it only lasts X amount of time) is that these champions that are "heal based"...rely on their heal. if it was as easy as buy "x item" then that champion would effectively be useless. Imagine if grievous wounds were easy to apply? What would vlad do? his one thing he does well, he now no longer does. Well then. That sucks. 

These champs can feel oppressive because of their sustain, but all 3 of the ones you mentioned are indeed vulnerable to being blown up. sure they can zhonyas, etc. but ultimately they do have counterplay. 

We need executioners calling back, but it needs to work similar to nomicon as a temporary debuff and only below a certain percentage. Eitherwise champs like vlad, swain, and soraka will just be effectively worthless.

This is a healthy way of looking at it.

Executioner's Calling in particular is an interesting case. Its biggest failing is that its stat profile was very unique, with the only item on SR sharing its stat space being Infinity Edge.
Within that duality of purpose, because champions that utilize that stat profile will never give up Infinity Edge, it had no direct comparison. Nothing you would switch for it. The results of this duality of purpose is you had to make a stats optimization case on top of your "I need to deal with this situation case". For most people, what you were trading away just wasn't worth it then.

Grievous wounds on an item is fine (more fine than on champions I would argue, excepting assassins), but if it's ever an expectancy then what will actually happen with the lacks of Vladimir, Mundo, and similar is over time their healing amounts will just creep up and creep up until they get their identities back.

Why are we comparing Infinity Edge to Executioner's Calling?

Sure they offered the same stats but the AD value each item offered wasn't even close.

I mean, IE gave like 70 AD whereas EC gave 25. Of course people will always buy IE over EC when it gives them so much more damage and burst.

If EC had it's cost gone up but gave those same 70 AD aswell, then maybe we could compare both, especially since IE wasn't even an actual core rush item before the Bloodthirster nerfs. But as it is, of course no one would ever buy EC over the IE.

Infact, they could actually switch the items passives and I doubt anyone would ever buy EC over IE.

That's the point.

To reiterate:
"it had no direct comparison"

Yeah, but in your post you said.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Reinboom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tBvJEsfH,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2015-10-22T17:38:07.882+0000) 
> Its biggest failing is that its stat profile was very unique, with the only item on SR sharing its stat space being Infinity Edge.

Which I don't believe is true.

The biggest failing point is not that the stats were too unique but too weak to ever be worth an actual itemslot.

If there was an upgrade for EC which gave the item actual visible powerful stats for an obviously increased but fair price, I doubt the item would ever be left to rot every game.

What reinboom meant was that both items had both AD and Crit, which is a very rare combo ({{item:3142}} being another, but serving a different purpose) BUT Infinity Edge is always a must-buy, thus you never have any reason to get EC. And even when you did it was a trap, because it didn't provide the stats to take up an item slot on its own.

Grievous Wounds is complicated because as long as it is as accessible as ON EVERY AUTO ATTACK, as it was for EC, it cannot then also be attached to a powerful item, because for champions that rely on strong healing to be effective, it becomes too easy to make them utterly useless just because you bought EC.

The reason that EC didn't have a superior upgrade is because of how it interacts with heal-reliant champs, so it had to be kept weak.

So MAKE one.

There needs to be more AD+Crit items in the game anyway. Having the major sources of crit be locked to attack speed forces you to go either full glass cannon getting tons and tons of multipliers, or full-bruiser getting just raw AD. There needs to be more options for people who just want to be AD+Crit or AD+Attack Speed.
Just remove GW and rebalance healing to compensate.

I believe that Grievous wounds has a place on items in summoners rift but I also see its danger being on something like and assassin or an ADC.  This is something I have been actually thinking about for a while as there are several champions that become nightmares with out taking ignite.  The problem with Executioner's calling is it didn't supply the stats to really warrant an ADC picking it up.  On the flip side could you imagine the nightmare it would be to have a high stat item with grievous wounds on it that fit into an ADC profile. The could supply large amounts of damage from the back row to several targets while prevent any recover from that damage.  The point of creating team, both in lol and outside of, its to have various players filing different roles and supplementing other members short comings.  Thats why I think the best place to look to adding a new grievous wound item would be a melee damage item for tanks.

Often jungle and top lane tanks are limited in the number of damage items they can really take while fulfilling the role.  And I believe this is a good thing as damage should be left to an ADC (not necessarily a ranged carry but an overall AD carry).  Tanks already have several damage items that help fulfill this role and tackle strengths of the other team.  The opposing team has a lot tanks pick black cleaver, your facing heavy ap well grab hex drinker, getting kited grab frozen mallet, and the other team takes top aatrox and jungle warwick well... him theres nothing to grab to stop that life gain.

I apologize for the long comment.  Sure to briefly finish up I think there should be a damage item for melee tanks that has both health and damage stats in a similar profile to those above mentioned items that applies grievous wounds.  Maybe something along the lines bami's cinder + phage = burning hammer.  Burning hammer +500 hp, +40 ad, Unique passive - on hit "ignites" enemies for 2 seconds dealing 5+(lvl) magic a second and applying grievous wounds while ignited.  (the two unique passive from the previous items get merged into a new singular passive) I originally said true damage on the ignite but I figure that would bring the item too close to the black cleaver's profile as an item for ignoring resistances.  

An item like this on melee champs means that they have to get into range of the target to apply the debuff.  So adc can still kite and life steal in team fights and it will be hard for the tank to be both a front liner for their carry and run around applying the debuff to everyone.  Thus not only creating unique decisions trees when itemizing against an apposing team but also in team fights on what your role needs to be with this item.

You say Grievous wounds is fine on assassin champs, yet it was intentionally removed from Fizz and Tristana.  Hell, AP Tristana herself was removed from the game.  Don't these cases directly contradict that sentiment?
